dt: {bc}the residence or establishment of a sovereign or similar dignitary
{bc}a sovereign's formal assembly of councillors and officers
{bc}the sovereign and officers and advisers who are the governing power

dt.t: The {wi}court{/wi} has decided against the alliance.

dt: {bc}the family and retinue of a sovereign
{bc}a manor house or large building surrounded by usually enclosed grounds
{bc}an open space enclosed wholly or partly by buildings or circumscribed by a single building

dt.t: the {wi}court{/wi} at the center of the palace

dt: {bc}a quadrangular space walled or marked off for playing one of various games with a ball (such as tennis, handball, or basketball)
{bc}a wide alley with only one opening onto a street
{bc}an official assembly for the transaction of judicial business {dx}see also {dxt|court-packing||}, {dxt|pack the court||}{/dx}
{bc}a place (such as a chamber) for the administration of justice

dt.t: sat quietly in the back of the {wi}court{/wi}

dt: {bc}a faculty or agency of judgment or evaluation

dt.t: … rest our case in the {wi}court{/wi} of world opinion …

dt: {bc}an assembly or board with legislative or administrative powers
{bc}conduct or attention intended to win favor or dispel hostility {bc}{sx|homage||}

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}curt, court{/it}, from Latin {it}cohort-, cohors{/it} enclosure, group, retinue, cohort, from {it}co-{/it} + {it}-hort-, -hors{/it} (akin to {it}hortus{/it} garden) {ma}{mat|yard|}{/ma}
shortdef: the residence or establishment of a sovereign or similar dignitary
a sovereign's formal assembly of councillors and officers
the sovereign and officers and advisers who are the governing power

dt: {bc}to act so as to invite or provoke
{bc}to seek to win a pledge of marriage from
{bc}to perform actions in order to attract for mating
{bc}to seek to attract (as by solicitous attention or offers of advantages)

dt.t: college teams {wi}courting{/wi} high school basketball stars
Both candidates were {wi}courting{/wi} the independent voters.

dt: {bc}to engage in social activities leading to engagement and marriage
{bc}to engage in activity leading to mating

dt.t: a pair of robins {wi}courting{/wi} in the trees

shortdef: to seek to gain or achieve
to act so as to invite or provoke

dt: {bc}a court that sits at two or more places within one judicial district

shortdef: a court that sits at two or more places within one judicial district

dt: {bc}a tennis court with a clay surface or a synthetic surface that resembles clay

shortdef: a tennis court with a clay surface or a synthetic surface that resembles clay

dt: {bc}a court in some states that has a designated jurisdiction usually both civil and criminal within the limits of a county

shortdef: a court in some states that has a designated jurisdiction usually both civil and criminal within the limits of a county

dt: {bc}a court consisting of commissioned officers and in some instances enlisted personnel for the trial of members of the armed forces or others within its jurisdiction

shortdef: a court consisting of commissioned officers and in some instances enlisted personnel for the trial of members of the armed forces or others within its jurisdiction

dt: {bc}a court that hears cases and decides them on the basis of statutes or the common law

shortdef: a court that hears cases and decides them on the basis of statutes or the common law

et: from {it}St. James's{/it} Palace, London, former seat of the British court

dt: {bc}a court that has jurisdiction to try and punish offenders against criminal law

shortdef: a court that has jurisdiction to try and punish offenders against criminal law

dt: {bc}a trial court that has jurisdiction over certain cases within a specific judicial district

shortdef: a trial court that has jurisdiction over certain cases within a specific judicial district
